intro: Loretia setacea, commonly known as the hairy loretia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems covered in fine, hairy textures. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Loretia setacea is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in meadows and woodland edges. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
